DataElement.preferredName: Bone Scan Medical Imaging Confirmed Assessment Treatment Course Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The identifier used to indicate the treatment course or cycle relating to a confirmatory (establishing or verifying) medical imaging assessment (the determination of the value, significance, or extent of) to create images of bones on a computer screen or on film.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Scan Medical Imaging Confirmed Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a confirmatory (establishing or verifying) medical imaging assessment (the determination of the value, significance, or extent of) to create images of bones on a computer screen or on film.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique to create images of bones on a computer screen or on film. A small amount of radioactive material is injected into a blood vessel and travels through the bloodstream; it collects in the bones and is detected by a scanner.:In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.
In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a protocol specific identifier used to indicate the treatment course or cycle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed max length from 10 to 6 and datatype to Number per CDUS clean-up.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Cycle number associated with current confirmatory scan
